intro: Chesneya parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered chesneya, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub with woody stems and narrow, gray-green leaves. Its small, yellowish flowers bloom in clusters, often in late spring or early summer. Chesneya parviflora is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
